metadata.dc:author: Hidalgo Togores, L
García Mediero, J M
Núñez Mora, C
de Fata Chillón, F Ramón
de la Peña Barthel, J J
Alonso Dorrego, J M
metadata.dc:description: Donor graft lithiasis is a unusual complication of renal transplantation, however, it is associated to a high morbidity. This pathology is due to several causes such us: metabolic factors, infectious disease, drugs, foreign bodies or transferred in the donor graft. The objective of the treatment is to remove the lithiasis without damaging the renal unit. We report the successful percutaneous anterograde treatment of an ureteral obstructive hard calculi, in renal allograft.
metadata.dc:title: Tratamiento endourológico percutáneo de litiasis ureteral obstructiva en injerto renal.
[Percutaneous endourologic treatment of obstructive ureteral lithiasis in renal transplant].
